ASSESSMENTS.title: Learner Self-Reflection 2 – 24354 (v3)
ASSESSMENTS.subtitle: Demonstrate knowledge of health and safety legislation and apply safe working practices in a BCATS environment

questions.text: 1. You are required to unload 15 x 40kg bags of cement off the back of a truck. The storage area is 75 metres away across a drive littered with construction waste. Describe the safest and most efficient means to get the cement into the storage area.
questions.hint: Clear path, use help, use trolley/wheelbarrow/pallet jack, reduce manual handling.

questions.text: 2. Describe the correct lifting techniques for a heavy load, such as a bag of cement.
questions.hint: Bend knees, straight back, keep load close, no twisting, lift with legs.

questions.text: 3. Describe the correct technique for carrying a sheet of plywood.
questions.hint: Two-person carry, on edge, communicate, keep vision clear.

questions.text: 4. Identify a risk associated with storing heavy items on shelves.
questions.hint: Falling objects, overloading shelves, crush injuries.

questions.text: 6. Describe the potential consequences of using a water type extinguisher on an electrical fire.

questions.hint: Assembly point / muster point used in an emergency evacuation.

ASSESSMENTS.title: Learner Self-Reflection 3 – 24354 (v3)
ASSESSMENTS.subtitle: Demonstrate knowledge of health and safety legislation and apply safe working practices in a BCATS environment

questions.text: 1. Your first job involves working on a roof. You feel uncomfortable at heights. What should you do?
questions.hint: Tell supervisor/teacher, request training, use correct safety equipment or alternative task.

questions.text: 2. What is the recommended angle ratio for a ladder when it is set up?
questions.hint: 4:1 ratio or around 75° / 70–75°.

questions.text: 3. Why are power lines an extreme hazard when you are carrying or using an aluminium ladder?
questions.hint: Aluminium conducts electricity → electrocution.

questions.text: 4. What is the minimum distance the top of a ladder should extend above a working platform?
questions.hint: 1 metre (about 1m).

questions.text: 5. Identify the possible consequences of directing compressed air at another person.
questions.hint: Eye injury from debris; air embolism; skin injection; serious injury/death.

questions.text:

ASSESSMENTS.title: Knowledge Assessment – 24354 (v3)
ASSESSMENTS.subtitle: Demonstrate knowledge of health and safety legislation and apply safe working practices in a BCATS environment

questions.text: 2. What is the main purpose of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 (‘the Act’)?
questions.hint: Secure health and safety of workers and workplaces; everyone goes home safely.

questions.text: 3. What are your responsibilities as a “worker” under the Act?
questions.hint: Take reasonable care, follow procedures, PPE, report hazards/incidents, help eliminate/minimise risks.

questions.text: 4. What is a person conducting a business or undertaking’s (PCBUs) main responsibility under the Act?
questions.hint: Ensure, so far as reasonably practicable, the health and safety of workers influenced or directed by the PCBU.
